description.narrative: 1. Project: 11773 Quality and accountability assurance FCA was certified against the Core Humanitarian Standard on Quality and Accountability (CHS) in 2017, and continues developing its quality and accountability management based on standard. This includes revision of policies, guiding documents, procedures and practices, as well as staff induction and capacity building. In 2018, the focus will be on accountability mechanisms. Certification means a full commitment to the CHS, and compliance will be verified annually through external audits. FCA will benefit CHS audit as well as external programme and global evaluations to improve organisational quality and accountability. 2. The main objective and the expected results: FCA ensures high quality programming, effective delivery, and accountability to all key stakeholders through a consistent, externally verifiable quality and accountability management system. Expected results: - CHS maintenance audit has been completed successfully, work plan to address the iss ues identified is in place, and related actions are incorporated in related annual plans. - Self-assessment against the CHS has been carried out and related capacity development plans have been designed in 3-4 country programmes. - FCA?s revised quality an d accountability management system and the ?Quality and Accountability Framework? are in place and maintained. - New ?FCA Partnership Policy?, partnership agreement procedure, and partner assessment process are introduced, and country programmes know how t o apply them. - Country Programmes know how to apply FCA Child Safeguarding Policy, and all programmes have a child safeguarding focal point in place. - Complaints response mechanism is in place and maintained in all Country Programmes, and programmes are supported in how to develop and maintain the mechanism. - Feedback mechanism based on Listen, Learn, Act approach (LLA) is piloted in 2-3 country programmes. 3. Rights-holders: Primary beneficiaries: FCA Head Office and Country Programme staff Secondary b eneficiaries: FCA?s partners, the communities and people FCA works with 4. Implementation partners: The project will be implemented by FCA and external consultants, except the CHS maintenance audit by the Humanitarian Quality Assurance Initiative (HQAI).
